name: Dusknoir
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw 2 cards. If you have 7 or more cards in your hand, discard a number of cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. Then, put 2 damage counters on Dusknoir. This power can't be used if Dusknoir is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Count the number of damage counters on Dusknoir. Put that many damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Dusknoir by your opponent's Pokemon that has 2 or less Energy attached to it during your opponent's next turn.

name: Empoleon
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Empoleon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Active Pokemon, you may use this power. Your opponent can't attach any Energy cards from his or her hand to his or her Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Empoleon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Infernape
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Infernape from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 4 Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Infernape by attacks is increased by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Infernape and this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Lumineon
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Lumineon is your Active Pokemon, you may look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent's Bench isn't full, choose 1 Basic Pokemon from your opponent's hand, and put it onto his or her Bench. Then, switch it with the Defending Pokemon. This power can't be used if Lumineon is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Lumineon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Magnezone
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Lightning or Metal Pokemon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to Magnezone.

name: Magnezone
flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Lightning or Metal Energy card and attach it to your Active Pokemon. Then, put 1 damage counter on that Pokemon. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: You may switch Magnezone with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. If you do, your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

name: Mismagius
Attack1Text: Choose up to 4 in any combination of Pokemon Tool cards and Technical Machine cards in play (both yours and your opponent's) and discard them. This attack does 20 damage times the number of cards discarded in this way.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has 4 or more Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and return that Pokemon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

name: Raichu
Attack1Text: Raichu can't use Slice during your next turn.
Attack2Text: Move an Energy card attached to Raichu to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Regigigas
Ability1Text: If you have Regirock, Regice, and Registeel in play, the attack cost of Regigigas's attacks is Colorless less.
Attack2Text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage. If you do, Regigigas does 40 damage to itself.

name: Sceptile
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), move a Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokemon to another of your Pokemon. This power can't be used if Sceptile is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Sceptile.

name: Torterra
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Torterra from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon, you may choose as many of your Grass Pokemon in play as you like. For each Grass Pokemon you choose, search your deck for an Evolution card that evolves from that Pokemon and evolve it. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack1Text: Torterra does 20 damage to itself. Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon, if any.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, when your opponent puts a Basic Pokemon from his or her hand onto his or her Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokemon.

name: Abomasnow
Ability1Text: As long as Abomasnow is your Active Pokemon, any damage done to your Pokemon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon, excluding Grass Pokemon and Water Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: If Abomasnow evolved from Snover during this turn, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Bronzong
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Then, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Bronzong is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Put a number of damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokemon equal to the number of Colorless Energy in that Pokemon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

name: Cherrim
Ability1Text: Each of your Grass Pokemon's and Fire Pokemon's attacks does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Drapion
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If 2 or more of them are heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Drifblim
Attack1Text: Put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. For each Basic Pokemon you put onto your Bench, you may search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to that Pokemon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Dusknoir
flavorText: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
Ability1Text: As long as Dusknoir is your Active Pokemon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokemon that has any Energy attached to it between turns.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Gengar
Ability1Text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Gengar would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is Knocked Out.
Attack1Text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. If that Pokemon has any Poke-Powers, put 6 damage counters on that Pokemon instead.
Attack2Text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Trainer, Supporter, and Stadium cards in your opponent's hand.

name: Gyarados
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage times the number of Magikarp in your discard pile.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card from your opponent's deck.

name: Machamp
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon isn't an Evolved Pokemon, that Pokemon is Knocked Out instead of damaged by this attack.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Mamoswine
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads or you may start again. Each time you start again, put 2 damage counters on Mamoswine. (If Mamoswine would be Knocked Out, you can't start again.)
Attack2Text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Swinub on your Bench, plus 20 more damage for each Piloswine on your Bench, and 40 more damage for each Mamoswine on your Bench.

name: Rapidash
Ability1Text: If Rapidash is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Rapidash is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokemon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Rapidash and choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Roserade
Ability1Text: If Roserade is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Roserade is Knocked Out), the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to that Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Salamence
Ability1Text: If your opponent has any Pokemon in play that has maximum HP of 120 or more, ignore all Colorless Energy necessary to use Salamence's attacks.
Attack2Text: Discard a Fire Energy and a Water Energy attached to Salamence.

name: Scizor
Ability1Text: If Scizor has 6 or more damage counters on it, any damage done to Scizor by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is Knocked Out by this attack, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Scizor during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If you don't have any Pokemon with any Poke-Powers in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Skuntank
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Skuntank from your hand to evolve 1 of your Active Pokemon, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon. If that Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, that attack does nothing.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Staraptor
Ability1Text: As long as Staraptor is your Active Pokemon, any damage done by attacks from your opponent's Stage 2 Evolved Pokemon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Steelix
flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.
Attack1Text: Choose a number of your opponent's Pokemon up to the amount of Energy attached to Steelix. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage times the number of heads.

name: Tangrowth
Ability1Text: Remove 1 damage counter from Tangrowth between turns.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If the first coin is heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused. If the second coin is heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Tyranitar
Ability1Text: After your opponent's Pokemon uses a Poke-Power, you may search your discard pile for a basic Darkness Energy card and attach it to Tyranitar.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Tyranitar.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Vespiquen
Ability1Text: As long as you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, Vespiquen's attacks do 10 more damage for each Grass Pokemon on your Bench to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: After your attack, remove from Vespiquen the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned, Paralyzed, and Poisoned.

name: Bibarel
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, excluding damage, done to Bibarel.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. That Pokemon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Budew
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Budew by your opponent's Poisoned Pokemon.
Ability2Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Roselia from your hand onto Budew (this counts as evolving Budew) and remove all damage counters from Budew.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Pokemon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Dusclops
flavorText: Its body is hollow. It is said that those who look into its body are sucked into the void.
Attack1Text: You may discard a card from your hand. If you do, your opponent discards a card from his or her hand.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Dusclops
flavorText: Its body is hollow. It is said that those who look into its body are sucked into the void.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: If you have a Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, remove 2 damage counters from Dusclops.

name: Electrode
Ability1Text: If Electrode is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Electrode is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokemon.
Attack1Text: If Electrode was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Electrode
flavorText: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to Electrode. Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electrode.

name: Farfetch'd
flavorText: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

name: Grovyle
flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

name: Haunter
flavorText: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: You may search your opponent's discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards and put them into your opponent's hand.

name: Machoke
flavorText: Machoke's boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Magneton
flavorText: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.
Attack1Text: If you have a Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Magneton
flavorText: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Miltank
Attack1Text: Draw a card.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Pichu
flavorText: The electric pouches on its cheeks are still small. They cannot store much electricity yet.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for up to 4 Lightning Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

name: Piloswine
flavorText: Its shaggy coat makes it unable to see. It checks surroundings with its sensitive nose instead.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Piloswine. Then, remove 4 damage counters from Piloswine.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Pupitar
flavorText: Its body is hard as bedrock. By venting pressurized gas, it can launch itself like a rocket.
Ability1Text: Any damage done to Pupitar by attacks is reduced by 10 for each Energy attached to Pupitar (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't reduce more than 30 damage in this way.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Sableye
Ability1Text: If Sableye is your Active Pokemon at the beginning of the game, you go first. (If each player's Active Pokemon has the Overeager Poke-Body, this power does nothing.)
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Supporter card and discard it. Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon has fewer remaining HP than Sableye, this attack's base damage is 40.

name: Scyther
flavorText: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja's.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slashing Strike attack's base damage is 60.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, Scyther can't use Slashing Strike.

name: Shelgon
flavorText: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Skarmory
flavorText: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speeds over 180 mph.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Staravia
flavorText: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokemon. It stays within a huge flock.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Bagon
flavorText: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Bidoof
flavorText: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to the Defending Pokemon. If tails, Bidoof does 10 damage to itself.

name: Bronzor
flavorText: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.
Attack1Text: Put a number of damage counters on the Defending Pokemon equal to the number of Colorless Energy in Bronzor's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Cherubi
flavorText: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Cherubi.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Combee
Attack1Text: Draw a card. Then, you may switch Combee with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Drifloon
flavorText: A Pokemon formed by the spirits of people and Pokemon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Duskull
flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokemon. If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, put 2 damage counters on that Pokemon instead.

name: Duskull
flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Finneon
flavorText: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Gastly
flavorText: This Pokemon's body is 95% made up of gases, which are blown away by strong gusts of wind.
Attack1Text: You opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: You may switch Gastly with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Larvitar
flavorText: A Pokemon that eats soil. Once it has eaten a large mountain, it goes to sleep so it can grow.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Machop
flavorText: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.
Attack2Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

name: Magikarp
flavorText: It is said to be the world's weakest Pokemon. No one knows why it has managed to survive.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, draw a card.

name: Magnemite
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Magnemite does 10 damage to itself.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Misdreavus
flavorText: It loves to sneak up on people late at night, then startle them with its shrieklike cry.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon is Asleep, this attack does 50 damage and remove 5 damage counters from Misdreavus. If the Defending Pokemon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

name: Onix
flavorText: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if Onix would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Onix if that damage is 40 or less.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity in the pouches on its cheeks.
Attack2Text: If Pikachu evolved from Pichu during this turn, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Pikachu during your opponent's next turn.

name: Ponyta
flavorText: About an hour after birth, its fiery mane and tail grow out, giving it an impressive appearance.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Ponyta during your opponent's next turn.

name: Roselia
flavorText: Roselia raised on clean drinking water are known to grow vividly colored flowers.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep and Poisoned. If Budew is anywhere under Roselia, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

name: Skorupi
flavorText: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Snover
flavorText: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Snover during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Starly
flavorText: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Stunky
flavorText: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
Attack1Text: Switch Stunky with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Swinub
flavorText: It loves eating mushrooms that grow under dead grass. It also finds hot springs while foraging.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Swinub does 10 damage to itself.

name: Tangela
flavorText: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to Tangela. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you do, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Tangela during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Treecko
flavorText: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokemon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: It looks just like a Poke Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.
Attack1Text: If an attack does damage to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to that Pokemon until the end of your next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: It looks just like a Poke Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

name: Dusknoir LV.X
Ability1Text: If Dusknoir is your Active Pokemon and would be Knocked Out by damage from your opponent's attack, you may discard all cards attached to Dusknoir LV.X and put Dusknoir LV.X as a Stadium card into play instead of discarding it. This counts as Dusknoir being Knocked Out and your opponent takes a Prize card. As long as you have Dusknoir LV.X as a Stadium card in play, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokemon between turns. If another Stadium card comes into play or Dusknoir LV.X is discarded by the effects of any attacks, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, Trainer, or Supporter cards, return Dusknoir LV.X to your hand.

name: Heatran LV.X
Ability1Text: Your opponent can't remove the Special Condition Burned by evolving or devolving his or her Burned Pokemon. (This also includes putting a Pokemon Level-Up card onto the Burned Pokemon.) Whenever your opponent flips a coin for the Special Condition Burned between turns, treat it as tails.
Ability2Text: Once at the end of your turn, if Heatran is on your Bench, you may use this power. If you discarded basic Energy cards attached to your Fire or Metal Active Pokemon by using that Pokemon's attack this turn, attach up to 2 of those Energy cards to that Pokemon.

name: Machamp LV.X
Ability1Text: As long as Machamp is your Active Pokemon, each of Machamp's attacks does 60 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance) and any damage done to Machamp by your opponent's Pokemon is increased by 60 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if Machamp would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, Machamp is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

name: Raichu LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Raichu LV.X onto Raichu and use Voltage Shoot, you may use another attack of Raichu afterward. This power can't be used if Raichu is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 Lightning Energy cards from your hand and choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 80 to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Regigigas LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of your Pokemon in play and that Pokemon is Knocked Out. Then, search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, attach them to Regigigas, and remove 8 damage counters from Regigigas. This power can't be used if Regigigas is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card from your opponent's deck. Then, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it. Regigigas can't use Giga Blaster during your next turn.

name: Charmander
flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.
Attack2Text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Charmander.

name: Charmeleon
flavorText: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.
Attack2Text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Charmeleon.

name: Charizard
flavorText: Its wings can carry this Pokemon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.
Ability1Text: All Energy attached to Charizard are Fire Energy instead of their usual type.
Attack1Text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Charizard.

name: Drifloon
Ability1Text: If Drifloon has a Pokemon Tool card attached to it, Drifloon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless more.
Attack2Text: Drifloon does 50 damage to itself.

name: Duskull
Attack1Text: Put up to 3 damage counters on Duskull. Then, put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Voltorb
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Voltorb.
